en.name: English
en.test: This Concept 0 is only for testing your browser’s rendering of characters; all sample characters shown here should agree with their description here; character encoding is Unicode UTF-8.

ar.name: Arabic
ar.test: ن = Arabic letter Noon (rounded u with 1 dot above)

bg.name: Bulgarian
bg.test: б = Cyrillic small letter be (bent-over b); й = Cyrillic small letter short i (reversed N with breve); щ = Cyrillic small letter shcha (inverted m with tail)

fa.name: Farsi/Persian
fa.test: پ = Arabic letter peh (wide u with 3 dots under); گ = Arabic letter gaf (open right-sloping b with bar above)

hr.name: Croatian
hr.test: š = s-caron; ž = z-caron; ć = c-acute; č = c-caron; đ = d-stroke

id.name: Bahasa Indonesia
id.test: Uses unaccented Latin-1 characters like English.

ja.name: Japanese
ja.test: ヨ = E reversed left to right; 田 = square with cross inside; ノ = right-leaning curved stroke

ko.name: Korean
ko.test: 투 = E over T; 이 = 0 followed by a vertical line.

la.name: Latin
la.test: Uses unaccented Latin-1 characters like English.

lt.name: Lithuanian
lt.test: ė = e with dot above; ą = a with tail (Ogonek); į = i with tail.

pl.name: Polish
pl.test: ł = small L with stroke; ę = small e with tail; ż = small z with dot above

ru.name: Russian
ru.test: щ = Cyrillic small letter Shcha (w with tail); я = Cyrillic small letter Ya (reversed R)

se.name: Swedish
se.test: å = a-ring; ä = a-diaeresis; ö = o-diaeresis.

sl.name: Slovenian
sl.test: š = s-caron (small v above); ž = z-caron; č = c-caron

sr.name: Serbian
sr.test: б = Cyrillic small letter be (bent-over b); и = Cyrillic small letter i (reversed N); ш = Cyrillic small letter sha (inverted m)

tr.name: Turkish
tr.test: ğ = g-breve; ş = s-cedilla; ı = i without dot

uk.name: Ukrainian
uk.test: щ = Cyrillic small letter Shcha (w with tail); я = Cyrillic small letter Ya (reversed R)

zh.name: Chinese
zh.test: 古 = rectangle surmounted by +；干 = T with mid horizontal stroke；(...) = Pinyin. Jìhuà = J, i-grave, h, u, a-grave.
